Start: ^Who do you want to talk to?
LadyDescription: ^Lady Mortimer is an elderly lady and quite the character.
^She wears a gold bird cage as a head ornament (which she insists isn't a hat) so she can be close to her dearest pet conure at all times.
LadyIntro: ^Ask Lady Mortimer what she was doing last night
^Ask about the person the Steward saw
LadyWhatHappened: ^May I call you Mort for short?
^Can you describe to me what happened last night?
^I was trying to enjoy a quiet drink with my dear friend Mr Lionel.
^I don't think I've met Mr Lionel, is he another passenger?
^Well of course you've met him, he's right here! (she gestures to the conure on her head)
^We were trying to have a quiet drink but the dining cart was awfully loud.
^Everyone on this train has terrible manners on this train, you know.
^We were about to leave anyway when that dreadful Inspector spilled a drink near me!
^But gave him a telling off nonetheless.
^Once he ran off I also retired to my bed chambers.
^Mr Lionel was quite shaken up by the whole ordeal so I had to tend to him.
^Are you feeling better now, Mr Lionel?
LadyWhodunnit: ^I get the sense you're a well travelled woman, Lady Mortimer.
^I've seen some things in my time, yes.
^Who do you think could have murdered that poor man?
^Oh I dread to think of it!
^A woman mustn't think of such horrible things!
^To talk of death this way, it's so crude!
^Some people have no respect for life.
^We don't have time for such vulgar conversation.
LadySecondStowaway: ^What do you make of the detectives theory?
^That there is a second stowaway on board
^...I guess it makes a certain amount of sense.
^Well the staff on these trains change so frequently
^Oh yes, it seems the Conductor struggles to keep her people in check...
^So it wouldn't be too hard for one of them to sneak someone on board.
LadySomeonesUp: ^The Steward says someone was up late last night.
^Were you up at all past midnight, Ma'am?
^I spent a while comforting Mr Lionel
^He refused to settle down last night!
^And when he eventually calmed down I was out like a light.
StewardDescription: ^The Steward is a young man who clearly isn't too enthused with his job but can't afford to get fired.
^He isn't very good at controlling his facial expressions so wears a face mask to keep them hidden and avoid trouble.
StewardIntro: ^Ask the Steward what they were doing last night
^Ask him what happened last night again
StewardWhatHappened: ^Can you explain what you were up to last night?
^Well as I'm sure you remember most of the passengers were taking drinks in the dining cart last night.
^I'm more of a 'here when you need me' type guy.
^So I was resting in the staff quarters for most of the night.
^Ask if he was sat there the whole night
StewardSatThere: ^You were just sat there, waiting to be called upon, the whole night?
^No one needed my services, I guess.
StewardCoverUp: ^It sounds to me like I'm not getting the full story.
^When none of the passengers need me...
^I TAKE NAPS IN THE STAFF ROOM OKAY!
^I wasn't even asleep for long this time though!
^I was woken up around 11.30, I was barely out for 20 minutes!
^That's more than enough time for you to miss something!
^There were birds screeching on top of the train.
^Must have been going through a flock of them or something?
^I don't know anything about birds but they were bloody loud.
^Not a fun way to wake up
StewardWhatHappenedAgain: ^Is there anything else you want to tell me?
^'Did you do anything else last night?'
^'Did you see anyone else last night?'

DoAnything: ^Did you do anything else last night?
^Are you sure you're telling me everything?
^I've told you everything I did last night!
^Woke up and continued to keep an eye out for guests!
^This doesn't seem like a good use of your time,
^Asking me the same questions over and over!
SeeAnything: ^Did you see anyoneone else last night?
^Lady Mortimer walked by at about... 20 past ten?
^And you were still awake at that time?
^I must've drifted off not long after that though...
^Until you were woken up by the bird noises?
^I didn't see anyone else until gone midnight.
^But they came from the rear sleeping cart
^And then went back in the direction they came
^AND YOU DIDN'T THINK TO LOOK INTO IT?!
^I don't go out of my way to see if they need help dragging their things around the train!
^BECAUSE IT MIGHT HAVE BEEN THE BODY!!

StewardWhodunnit: ^So you must have a pretty good take on everyone on this train, right?
^If you had to pick someone, who would you suspect murdered the poor man?
^I don't know the passengers that well!
^I know who takes tea before bed, not who has a homicidal streak!
^No one walked towards the end of the train after the Lady went to bed
^And the stowaway was found dead in the dining cart
^So I'd assume it was someone who sleeps in the rear of the train?
^Perhaps Sands, he seems awfully interested in this whole thing.
^She says she needs it to fall asleep.
StewardSecondStowaway: ^Do you think a second stowaway could have committed the murder?
^It's a small train, I can't imagine multiple people would go unnoticed.
^...but to be fair, I didn't think there would be one stowaway in the first place
^It is a bit of a plot twist, eh?
^she normally runs such a tight ship.
^She can't be feeling good about having not noticed a stowaway
SandsDescription: ^Inspector Sands is a middle aged gentlemen, a P.I (and a hack one at that).
^He wears a brown trench coat and carries a magnifying glass everywhere he goes, like he belongs in a cartoon.
SandsIntro: ^Ask Sands what he was doing last night
^Ask about the person the Steward saw moving something
SandsWhatHappened: ^I remember having a rousing debate with you about the proper pronunciation of 'scone'
^Ah yes, Inspector, I remember that well.
^I guess we're all entitled to our opinions...
^At some point Docor squashed passed me on his way back to his bedchambers...
^Which made me spill my drink on Lady Mortimer
^She was not best pleased so I escaped away to my own bed shortly afterwards.
^I've seen a lot in my time
SandsWhodunnit: ^So I hear you are something of a detective, Sands?
^So what do you make of all of this?
^Who do you think committed this crime?
^I was wondering when you'd ask me!
^You learn a lot in this line of work
^(...but the body found was a stowaway?)

SECONDSTOWAWAY: ^So there must be a SECOND STOWAWAY!

SandsWhodunnitRidiculous: ^Isn't that a bit of a stretch, Inspector?
^For all we know it was probably you!
^Why else would you try and discredit a professional like myself??
^I've got my eye on you lad.
^I'm not a lad I'm a robot.
^You're an idiot, that's what you are.
^You don't want to be my enemy.
SandsWhodunnitAgree: ^I'm not a lass I'm a robot.
^You're a damn genius, that's what you are!
^I have your back, no matter what.
SandsSomeonesUp: ^Walking from the rear cart to past the staff quarters and back again.
^But why do you bring this up?
^I suspect they may have been dragging...
^Which would suggest the murder took place in the rear sleeping carriage.
^You are saying the murder took place in the same carriage I was in?
^I would have been able to stop it!
^CRIME NEVER SLEEPS AND NEITHER DO I!
^...and if I did sleep I wouldn't sleep through that!
ConductorDescription: ^The Conductor is a middle-aged woman who is very proud of this train.
^She thinks she is a sea captain, and although you haven't seen her since boarding the train, other passengers say she wears an old sailors hat on her head.
^You talk to her through a rusty intercom.
ConductorIntro: ^Ask the Conductor what she was doing last night
^Ask about the person the Steward saw
ConductorWhatHappened: ^This is the Conductor, at your service!
^Oh please, no need for the formalities!
^I wanted to ask you what happened last night as you remember it?
^Well, naturally, I was stuck in here the whole night
^(I always miss out on the parties)
^But I heard you guests had a...
^Is that what the kids call it these days?
^Well all I know is the booze supplies took quite a hit
^Always brings out the worst in people, it seems.
^That matches up with what I remember.
^So you were really stuck in there the whole time?
^My wife's cat often joins me on my shifts.
^He's a bit of a blighter but a jolly good first mate nonetheless.
^Are cats allowed on fancy cross-country trains?
ConductorWhodunnit: ^As the head of this fine locomotive-
^She's more than fine she is superb!
^Well, do you have any idea who may have done this?
^Being holed up in here I haven't seen much of the action.
^But rest assured they will be dealt with when we arrive!

ConductorSuggestSteward: ^You should talk to someone more involved.

ConductorSecondStowaway: ^Have you heard the Inspector's latest theory?
^People often forget to update me on these things.
^'He thinks maybe a second stowaway is on board, and they committed the murder?'
^'He reckons you've let a murderer sneak on board.'

ConductorSecondStowawayNice: ^He thinks maybe a second stowaway is on board, and that they committed the murder?
^Sorry I couldn't be of more help.
ConductorSecondStowawayRude: ^He reckons you've let a murderer sneak on board
^I run a tight ship here, Skipper!
^(No-one said you didn't know about it)

ConductorSomeoneUp: ^The Steward saw someone up after bedtime last night.
^I don't have a lot of hot goss to share.
StoctorDescription: ^The Doctor is a quiet fellow who tends to blend into the background.
^He wears a venetion mask and his heavy cloak smells of potent chemicals.
StoctorIntro: ^Ask the Doctor what he was doing last night
^Ask about the person the Steward saw
StoctorWhatHappened: ^Can I ask you a few questions?
^I was in the dining cart having some drinks.
^I do hope I didn't contribute to your early departure?
^I said your mask made you look like the Lady's bird?
StoctorWhodunnit: ^So Doctor, do you have any suspicions as to who the culprit is?
^Any medical insight, perhaps, based on the body?
^Well, you can never really be sure.
^For all we know, it may have not even been a murder!
^You see it all in the medical world.
^For all we know, he had a medical issue which took him away unexpectedly.
^(Hm. Isn't a bullet wound pretty obvious though?)
^Well, you are the expert, I suppose.
^I think I'll continue to treat this as suspicious circumstances, though.
StoctorSecondStowaway: ^What do think about the theory of a second stowaway?
^I'm surprised an educated man such as youself would consider it
^Maybe the theory does hold some weight?
^could sneak on board, why not more?
^It could be a whole family operation!
^A single stowaway would surely be discovered without someone to watch their back.
^Only an idiot would try and sneak onto a fancy train like this without backup.
StoctorSomeoneUp: ^The Steward saw someone up after bed last night.
^The Steward said they appeared to be...
^Now you mention it, I know exactly what you mean!
^Taking some of my medical journals out of my bedchambers.
^It good to set up a rest/work divide, you know?
^'I was thinking it sounded more like a body was being dragged.'

ThatsOdd: ^Well yes I of course moved them back into my room this morning!!
^I need them to do my medicine work!
^Now I must get back to those books, if you don't mind!
ABody: ^I was thinking it sounded more like a body being dragged.
^I was ...going through everyones rooms while you were at the party
^The Doctor came back while I was in his room so I hid in the closet
^While I was in there someone came into his room and killed him!
^...This is a lot of new information.
^All I know is someone came in and killed the guy
^I made the best of a bad situation
^And took his body to the dining cart so it wouldn't be found with me
^I'm a thief but not a murderer, I swear!
^This explains why you made no sense when I asked about doctor stuff.
